WRITING.TEXT: My mom said this: you're thin now, when I look at your arms I don't see a layer of far, I only see your muscle! (In hysterical worried mom tone) mom, what's wrong with low body fat and muscle definition???? Hello?!?!

My number one goal: making it to the gym at least 5 times a week without excuses. I went through some horrible DOMS this week and really couldn't work out since Friday! My second goal is building a booty. Since I lost over 60 pounds my butt has completely disappeared. I've started to see progress through my workout, so I'm motivated! Third goal is to be able to do a pull up.
I'm 5" 2, 113 lbs, and female.

I'm interested! Thank you! Today I was actually fired for very unfair and stupid reasons from my waitressing job, and I'm moving to another town in a few weeks, which means I'll be bored and home a lot! Worried about eating too much out of boredom... But no excuses for getting to the gym!

Honestly, ignore what the people around you say. Eat whatever fits your regime and to hell with what they say or think. This is easier said than done, but as time goes by the people around you will know to respect your wishes.. To give you and example, on passover dinner everyone ate 4 mazo balls. I ate one. I got so many dirty looks, I could hear their thoughts thinking I'm crazy. But who wins in the end? YOU. You win control, you win self confidence, you win trust in yourself. Yes, just by resisting temptation. It makes you THAT much stronger.
Your posts are very well made and helpful. Thank you! I'm following you on instragram now
That would be... An efficient way to generate male attention
Wearing a dress when you deadlift, beautiful legs! Oh no. But wait, oh hey, beautiful bruises! Damn...
15 squats 3 times, dead lift 8 twice

WRITING.TITLE: Rather confused with workouts for the butt and legs
WRITING.TEXT:
So I hope its OK to post here like this. I'm 22 years old and went through a long weight loss process from 80 kg (176lbs) to right now 52 kg (114 lbs). I started going to the gym around 6 months ago, started with elliptical and Zumba and a bit of weights, typical beginner girl workout. Around a month ago a trainer built a new program for me, lifting more weight and getting a bit more serious into lifting. In the 6 months in the gym I went from 59 kg (130 lbs) and 32% body fat to 52 kg (114 lbs) and 22% body fat.
The program is as follows:
15x3 barbell squat 25kg (55 lbs)
2x8 deadlift 30kg (66 lbs)
10x3 Butterfly press with 4kg dumbbell (8 lbs)
12x3 bench press with 5kg dumbbell (11 lbs)
12x3 shoulder press with 4kg dumbbell (8 lbs)
12x3 assisted pull ups 36 kg (80 lbs)
20 sit ups followed by 1 minute plank x3
I do this routine 3 times a week followed by 20-30 minutes of cardio (elliptical or running)
My issue is that I naturally have chunkier legs than core and my butt went a bit flat after losing weight. Now with the squats I feel like my butt did get a bit perkier, but my thighs are increasing way too much in size, and its not what I'm looking for personally. I know many women like gains in the legs, but as a former fattie I'm looking for leaner legs. Also being very short at 159 cm (5" 2) when my legs are bigger I just look shorter. Yes, I'm squatting low and slow and engaging my glutes just in case you were wondering.
So what can I do to stop gaining mass on my quads? What can I change, add or take out from my program to have leaner legs and a nicer butt?
Are programs like strong curves good for somebody like me? I really want to get serious about weight lifting, but I want to stay lean since its very important for me. Any tips and suggestions are welcome!
If you have the brand Bayer where you live, run and buy bepanthene ointment. Life saver!! Also Nuxe reve de miel in the jar

WRITING.TITLE: Snacking help
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey guys, so lately I've been having trouble with snacking on small things during the day. For example, just a few cranberries, half a cookie, a few strawberries, a piece of chocolate... You get my point. This wasn't an issue before, but after hitting my goal weight I guess I'm being less strict with myself.
Do you have any tips that could help me stop munching on unnecessary things? Whether it's an action, a thought or an idea, I'd love to hear.
Thanks in advance.
This came out wrong. I meant is it mashed fresh strawberries with a fork, or like you blended them? Frozen or fresh? Need to make this ASAP and I have strawberries in the fridge!
You just mashed fresh strawberries?

I haven't counted calories for one day in my life, went from 80kg to 52. No, you don't need to count calories. I'm the kind of person that WILL get obsessed with doing that kind of thing, and that's why I decided not to do it. Good luck
Looks amazing!!!
Nice shortcut, thank you
Kinda like a Mexican shakshuka on top of tortilla? Sounds delicious!
Yeah we actually eat this where I live, very fond of it. Especially with roasted bell pepper and feta cheese
Thanks!!

WRITING.TITLE: Any good recipes with poached eggs?
WRITING.TEXT: I recently learned how to poach an egg, and it's all I want to eat. Any cool and healthy ideas on what to eat them with?
I had this happen on my arms! Do not worry. What worked for me was a very thick moisturizer for sensitive skin, without fragrance. Like Avene cold cream.

My boyfriend and I eat out multiple times a week and I still managed to lose weight very well. I usually take a salad or soup (unless its a high-carb soup like lentils or potatoes). If I feel like indulging a bit more I take an entre. Or a normal dish like chicken breast and I don't eat the side dish, or only a small part of it. Some tips- drink lots of water before eating and during, you'll be more full and less tempted. No dressing on the salad. Nothing full of butter. You can try other peoples dishes just one bite.
Definitely law and order special victims unit

A month ago I finished a six month course. Redness is better, though I still get extremely red when I exercise. My face is still normal to dry. My lips went back to normal after 2-3 weeks (they were never severely dry) my rye dryness is gone too! Unless its super windy.
Way too many! LOTR, pirates of the Caribbean, the notebook, inception... Just to mention a few
The star brand for me is Nuxe. The "reve de miel" series, the lip balm and moisturizer. Just amazing. Also, bepanthene eye drops, Avene cold cream for the body. Vichy capital soleil sunscreen
Pain that causes me to vomit. Light sensitivity, noise sensitivity, dizziness. The feeling somebody put my head in a food processor.
What a precious picture

When I started running it was way worse. And I would stop running and switch to walking if I felt something bad approaching. Over the course of a few months it got way better and even during the 6k I didn't feel I needed it.
Awesome!!! Good job
